title: How to Add a Chatbot to Your Website
description: Capture leads 24/7 with a chatbot that answers questions and books appointments.
requirements: Access to edit your website (or your web person's help)
A list of common questions customers ask

steps.title: Choose a chatbot platform
steps.description: Several free options work great for small businesses.
substeps: Tidio: Free for 50 conversations/month â€” tidio.com (recommended for beginners)
HubSpot Chat: Free with HubSpot CRM â€” hubspot.com
Drift: Free tier available â€” drift.com
Tawk.to: Completely free â€” tawk.to
steps.tip: Tidio is the easiest to set up. Tawk.to is free but more complex.

steps.title: Sign up and create your bot
steps.description: Get started with the free tier.
substeps: Go to tidio.com and click 'Get Started Free'
Enter your email and website URL
Choose 'Lead Generation' as your goal
Select your industry (Construction/Home Services)

steps.title: Customize your greeting
substeps: Change the default greeting to something friendly
Example: 'Hi! ðŸ‘‹ Looking for [your service]? I can answer questions or help you schedule a free estimate.'
Keep it short and action-oriented
Add a few quick reply buttons: 'Get a Quote', 'Our Services', 'Contact Info'

steps.title: Set up automated responses
substeps: Go to 'Automation' or 'Chatbots' section
Add common Q&As: pricing, service area, hours, how to book
For pricing: 'Our pricing varies by project. Can I get your info for a free quote?'
Always end with a way to capture their contact info
steps.tip: Use ChatGPT to help write these responses: 'Write a friendly chatbot response about [topic] for a [trade] business.'

steps.title: Add the chatbot to your website
substeps: In Tidio: Go to Settings â†’ Installation
Copy the code snippet
Paste it in your website's HTML (usually before </body>)
If using Wix/Squarespace/WordPress: They have dedicated integrations
Save and refresh your website â€” the chat bubble should appear

steps.title: Test and refine
steps.description: Make sure it actually works well.
substeps: Open your website in an incognito window
Click the chat and try common questions
Check that leads are being captured
Review chat logs weekly and add new Q&As as needed

successMessage: Your chatbot is live! 50% of website visitors leave without contacting you â€” now you're capturing them.
proTips: Connect to your email to get notified when someone chats
Add operating hours â€” bot can say 'We'll respond during business hours'
Review chat transcripts monthly to find common questions you haven't answered
